name: UpdateTeamRepoPermissions
description:
Manage team repository access and permissions.

Use this tool to add a repository to a team or update a team's permission on a repository within an organization. The caller must have admin access and visibility of the team. The repository should be owned by the organization. Returns a confirmation of the action taken.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The name of the organization. This parameter is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug identifier of the team within the organization. It is not case-sensitive.

value_schema.description: The slug of the team name.

parameters.name: repository_owner_account
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository to be managed. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: team_repo_permission
parameters.description: Permission to grant the team on this repository. Options: `pull`, `triage`, `push`, `maintain`, `admin`, or a custom role name defined by the organization. Defaults to team's current permission if unspecified.

value_schema.description: The permission to grant the team on this repository. We accept the following permissions to be set: `pull`, `triage`, `push`, `maintain`, `admin` and you can also specify a custom repository role name, if the owning organization has defined any. If no permission is specified, the team's `permission` attribute will be used to determine what permission to grant the team on this repository.
